definition: mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
land used for growing plants/site used for public recreation/abbr. for a place ending in 園|园, such as a botanical garden 植物園|植物园, kindergarten 幼兒園|幼儿园 etc

sentences.english: Jingshan Park lies right to the north of the Palace Museum.
sentences.chinese: 景山公园坐落在故宫博物院的正北。

sentences.english: So, is Jingshan Park China’s answer to Hyde Park?
sentences.chinese: 那么，中国的景山公园是另一个海德公园吗？

sentences.english: I think I hear the answer calling out to me from Jingshan Park's dancing square.
sentences.chinese: 我想，在景山公园的舞蹈广场里，我听到了答案。

sentences.english: Then driving to visit Jingshan Park and Beihai Park.
sentences.chinese: 然后开车到景山公园和北海公园参观。
不管怎样，我再继续谈景山公园。

sentences.english: Another worthwhile morning destination is Jingshan (Coal Hill) Park, behind the Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 另一个值得早上去的目的地是景山公园。

sentences.english: The view with the Jiangshan Park, the park near the Forbidden City.
sentences.chinese: 景山公园的景色啊，就是紫禁城附近的那个公园。

definition: Jingshan (name of a hill in Jingshan park)
Shichahai, scenic area of northwest Beijing with three lakes
Tower of Buddhist Incense in the Summer Palace 頤和園|颐和园[Yi2 he2 yuan2], Beijing
Tiananmen Gate, entrance of the Imperial City in Beijing
Houhai, a lake and the area surrounding it in central Beijing
Badaling, a particular section of the Great Wall that is a favorite tourist destination
Zhongshan Park, the name of numerous parks in China, honoring Sun Yat-sen 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1]
Mutianyu, well-preserved section of the Great Wall 70km from Beijing
